<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// SampleProfileWriter::writeWithSizeLimit() calls this after every write</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// iteration if the output size still exceeds the limit. This function</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// should erase some functions from the profile map so that the writer tries</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to write the profile again with fewer functions. At least 1 entry from the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// profile map must be erased.</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// In this default implementation, functions with fewest samples are dropped</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// first. Since the exact size of the output cannot be easily calculated due</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to compression, we use a heuristic to remove as many functions as</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// necessary but not too many, aiming to minimize the number of write</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// iterations.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Empirically, functions with larger total sample count contain linearly</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// more sample entries, meaning it takes linearly more space to write them.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The cumulative length is therefore quadratic if all functions are sorted</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// by total sample count.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// TODO: Find better heuristic.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sampleprof/defaultfunctionpruningstrategy/#a8abb143feff2f640ccc483ba91019c1b">Erase</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CurrentOutputSize) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">override</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Set the profile to be partial. It means the profile is for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="375"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::error&#95;code compressAndOutput();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="376"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="377"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We will swap the raw&#95;ostream held by LocalBufStream and that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// held by OutputStream if we try to add a section which needs</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="379"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// compression. After the swap, all the data written to output</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="380"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// will be temporarily buffered into the underlying raw&#95;string&#95;ostream</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="381"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// originally held by LocalBufStream. After the data writing for the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="382"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// section is completed, compress the data in the local buffer,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="383"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// swap the raw&#95;ostream back and write the compressed data to the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="384"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// real output.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="385"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;raw&#95;ostream&gt; LocalBufStream;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The location where the output stream starts.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t FileStart;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="388"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The location in the output stream where the SecHdrTable should be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="389"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// written to.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t SecHdrTableOffset;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="391"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The table contains SecHdrTableEntry entries in order of how they are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="392"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// populated in the writer. It may be different from the order in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="393"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SectionHdrLayout which specifies the sequence in which sections will</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// be read.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::vector&lt;SecHdrTableEntry&gt; SecHdrTable;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FuncOffsetTable maps function context to its profile offset in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SecLBRProfile section. It is used to load function profile on demand.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
